details.S: In a small saucepan, heat the sugar and water until the sugar is dissolved completely. Cool slightly.
Pour into a pitcher. Add the lemon juice. Add about 4 cups of water, more or less to the desired strength. Refrigerate 30-40 minutes. Serve over ice.

name.S: red Hawaiian Punch or 1 can concentrate

full_string.S: 1 large can red Hawaiian Punch or 1 can concentrate
Ice ring - made with Hawaiian Punch (optional)

notes.S: or 1 can concentrate (mixed according to directions)

full_string.S: 1 large bottle/can pineapple juice - or 1 can concentrate (mixed according to directions)

details.S: Mix all ingredients, adding pop just before serving. Serves 35 cups. Add more or less of ingredients to suit your tastes.
Dissolve Jello in water. Add the remaining ingredients, except for ginger ale. Freeze. (I use 2 ice cream buckets).
Take out of the freezer approximately 5 hours before serving. Add ginger ale. Also very good made with apricot, raspberry or a mixture of red Jellos.

description.S: This Hot Chocolate Recipe was prepared and served by Mary Jo McFadden when she entertained the Brunkhorst/McFadden families at Christmas. This recipe was submitted by several family members with notes attached how each would look forward to this awesome treat each year! (Note: Mary Jo is known for always typing instead of writing. She was also noted for calling her children and siblings in the morning to wish them a "good day!" Mary Jo is sadly missed by all who knew her.)

details.S: Mix sugar and cocoa, stir to a smooth paste with the boiling water. Heat over the direct flame and then cook in a double boiler for about 30 minutes, or until a thick paste is formed. Chill.

Whip cream. Fold in cocoa paste, scald milk in double boiler or pan, add vanilla and salt. When serving hot chocolate, put chocolate mixture in a bowl and hot milk in a pitcher. Put a large spoonful of chocolate mixture in cup: add hot milk. Be sure milk is scalding hot; otherwise beverage will be lukewarm because of the cold paste that is added. I put sugar with my whipping cream when I whip it and some vanilla too.

description.S: This recipe was a  recipe of Grandma Anna Brunkhorst, submitted by granddaughter, Ann Fabric, daughter of Della Wintakger.Note received by Vivian Shane, daughter of Della and sister to Ann: I used to stay during high school years with Grandma Brunkhorst in her home in Lamont, Iowa. This was only on nights when I had special practice. At our evening meal, Grandma served me a small glass of her homemade dandelion wine. Since I was a teenager and had not drank wine I was very frustrated as to whether I should drink it or not. Finally, I rationalized Anna was my mother's mother so she wouldn't serve me anything I shouldn't have. I drank the wine!

details.S: Remove any stems from the flowers. Put the flowers in a large, warm crock and pour the boiling water over them. Let stand for a week.

Strain, squeezing all the juice out of the flowers; then discard. Add the slices of lemon, orange, and the cloves; stir well. Add the yeast which has been softened in the warm water. Let stand, covered for another 2 weeks.
Strain again and pour into wine bottles. Let the bottles stand uncorked for 5 days. Cork or cap bottles. Let wine develop for at least 2 months.

description.S: This recipe was submitted by Patricia Brunkhorst Maas in memory of her dad, Joe Brunkhorst, who had this coffee every day.

details.S: Combine brewed coffee and milk; add bread and eat.

full_string.S: 2 bottles fruity red wine (Merlot or Shiraz)

details.S: Heat sugar and water in a saucepan, stirring until sugar melts. Cool.
Mix simple syrup, Grand Marnier, red wine and fruit. Chill overnight.
Heat sugar and water in a saucepan, stirring until sugar melts. Cool.
Mix simple syrup, Schnapps, wine, and fruit. Chill overnight.
To serve: Fill glass halfway with wine over ice. Add fruit and top with champagne.
Fill pitted date with cream cheese and pecan half.
Wrap with a small piece of bacon. Secure with a toothpick.
Broil until bacon is crisp.

full_string.S: ½ cup reduced fat sour cream
2 packages frozen miniature phyllo shells - thawed
1 kiwi fruit - peeled, sliced, cut into quarters

details.S: Combine all the ingredients except fruit.
Pipe or spoon filling into phyllo shells.
Top each with fruit. Refrigerate until serving time. (I've substituted sliced strawberries for one of the fruits to add color.)

notes.S: I use ⅓ less fat, don't use fat free

full_string.S: 1 (8 oz package) cream cheese - I use ⅓ less fat, don't use fat free
¾ cup mini chocolate chips - more chips for rolling in

details.S: Mix together and refrigerate until you can form into a ball, about 2 hours. I just use a spatula and mound it on a plate and use a spoon to press chocolate chips on the outside. Serve with graham sticks. Enjoy!

full_string.S: ¼ cup green pepper - finely chopped

notes.S: yellow, and green apple, cut into wedges

full_string.S: 1 red - yellow, and green apple, cut into wedges

details.S: In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients except the apples and the crackers; mix well.
Line the bottom of a 9-inch round cake pan with waxed paper. Press cheese mixture firmly into pan. Cover and refrigerate several hours or until firm.
To serve, arrange the apple slices on top and at the base of the cheese wheel. Serve with assorted crackers. Makes 5 cups of spread.
In a blender, chop dried beef and set aside a small amount to roll ball in.
Combine dried beef, onion, Worcestershire sauce, Accent and Tabasco sauce. Mix well with softened cream cheese.
Form into a ball; then roll in leftover dried beef.
Mix together cream cheese and Hidden Valley Ranch dressing. Spread cream cheese mixture on bread. Top with a slice of cucumber. Sprinkle with dill weed. Refrigerate.

full_string.S: 1 (4 oz can) mushroom stems and pieces

details.S: In a bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients.
Spread on bread slices and place on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes or until bubbly.

full_string.S: 1 lb pork sausage - cooked and crumbled

name.S: Hidden Valley Original Ranch salad dressing

full_string.S: 1 cup Hidden Valley Original Ranch salad dressing - prepared
½ cup sweet red pepper - chopped

details.S: Preheat the oven to 350°. Blot sausage dry with paper towels and combine with cheeses, salad dressing, olives and red pepper.
Lightly grease muffin tin and press 1 wrapper in each cup. Brush with oil. Bake for 5 minutes until golden.
Remove from tins, place on baking sheet. Fill with sausage mixture. Makes 4-5 dozen.

full_string.S: 1½ lb chicken breast - cooked and chopped

name.S: red or green peppers or a combination

full_string.S: 1 cup red or green peppers or a combination - finely chopped

details.S: Preheat the oven to 350°.
Lightly grease muffin tin and press 1 wrapper in each cup. Mix remaining ingredients and spoon into wontons.
Bake for 10 minutes at 350°.

full_string.S: Ground beef - prepared with taco seasoning

details.S: Gently crush chips. Cut the bag of chips open lengthwise. Add desired ingredients starting with meat. Add plastic fork. Enjoy!

description.S: Optional: May squeeze lemon juice over the top for more flavor. Note: Make sure tomatoes and lobster meat are well drained before putting onto pizza. Otherwise crust will be soggy.

full_string.S: 4 oz Roma tomatoes - diced ⅜-inch and drained

notes.S: cut into ½ to ¾-inch chunks

full_string.S: 2 oz lobster or shrimp - cut into ½ to ¾-inch chunks

details.S: Brush top side of tortilla with garlic butter. Sprinkle 2 (tbsp) Parmesan cheese over the garlic butter.
Add drained, diced tomatoes; sprinkle evenly over Parmesan cheese. Add basil.
Sprinkle seafood over top. Sprinkle the Italian cheese blend evenly over the top of tomatoes. Refrigerate until ready to bake.
Brush pizza pan lightly with vegetable oil. Bake at 450° for 4-5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Slice into 8 slices. Can be used as an appetizer or for a main dish.

full_string.S: 1 package Hidden Valley Ranch Party mix

notes.S: peppers, celery, cauliflower, carrots, broccoli, etc., chopped

full_string.S: Onions - peppers, celery, cauliflower, carrots, broccoli, etc., chopped

details.S: Roll out the crescent rolls on a greased pizza pan. Bake at 400° for 5-10 minutes or until golden brown.

Mix cream cheese, Hidden Valley Ranch and a small amount of milk together. Spread on the cooled crust. Add all of the chopped vegetables on top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and dill weed if desired. Refrigerate.
Mix cream cheese, sour cream, and garlic powder. Add cheese and crab.
Spread approximately ⅓ cup mixture on taco shells to cover entire shell. Roll up. Place in pan with waxed paper in between each roll. Refrigerate overnight for best flavor.
Cut into serving size pieces . Serve with cocktail sauce, if desired.
Mix cream cheese, sour cream and taco seasoning. Add olives, chilies and cheese; mix well.

Spread roughly ¼ to ⅓ cup mixture on each soft shell or enough for layer of spread to cover shell. Roll up. Place on pan with waxed paper between each roll. Refrigerate to cool, best if chilled overnight.
When ready to serve, cut each roll into ¾ to 1-inch slices, or desired width. Can serve with salsa and additional cheese, if desired. Optional are the green chilies.

notes.S: cut off tips in half at the joint

full_string.S: 2 dozen chicken wings - cut off tips in half at the joint

details.S: Mix together all ingredients except chicken wings. Dip chicken wings in sauce and place in a 9x13-inch glass cake pan.
Pour remaining marinade over and marinate overnight in refrigerator. (I've made them without marinating them overnight and they were just as good.)
Bake slow, 300 degrees for approximately 2 hours or until dark. These can be made ahead of time and frozen. If frozen, reheat at 325° for 20-30 minutes or in microwave.

description.S: I submitted this recipe to Taste of Home. It is published in the Taste of Home's 5-Ingredient Cookbook.

name.S: sour cream and onion potato chips

full_string.S: 2½ cup sour cream and onion potato chips - finely crushed

details.S: Cut chicken into bite size pieces; place into a bowl. Add salad dressing and stir to coat. Let stand 10 minutes. Add potato chips and toss well.
Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 18-20 minutes or until juices run clear. Yield: 4 servings. Serve with additional salad dressing.
Put cocktail sausages and BBQ sauce in a crockpot on low until hot and ready to serve.
Wrap bacon around the smokie links with enough bacon to go around links.
Seal with toothpick and cover with brown sugar. Bake for 30-45 minutes at 350°.
Beat cream cheese with milk until smooth. Stir in chopped chipped beef, sour cream, instant minced onion, garlic powder and pepper.
Spread in a small baking dish. Sprinkle with melted butter. Bake at 350° until warm. Serve with crackers, chips or rye bread.

notes.S: I use 2 12 oz packages of Jimmy Dean Original Sausage

full_string.S: 1 lb pork sausage - I use 2 12 oz packages of Jimmy Dean Original Sausage

details.S: Brown together and stir the ground beef and pork sausage. Drain off all drippings. Stir in cheese and melt. Add oregano and garlic powder.

Spread on individual party rye bread while warm. Put on cookie sheets, freeze, and then bag. To serve, heat under broiler until bubbly. Makes 48. These can go from freezer to broiler any time there is a party.
Melt together. Will refrigerate and still remain soft. Great with apple slices.

full_string.S: ½ cup red or green pepper - chopped

details.S: Mix all ingredients. Microwave until bubbling.
Garnish with sliced black olives and cilantro.
Blend frozen orange juice concentrate with instant pudding. Fold in sour cream and chill.
Serve with melon, strawberries, grapes, kiwi and other desired fruit. Keeps up to 1 week in the refrigerator.

name.S: Dried Beef Or Corned Beef Dip

details.S: Cut beef into very tiny pieces, saving part of the package to decorate around the bowl.
Cream mayonnaise and cream cheese together, adding remaining ingredients. Chill in a meat-lined bowl. Great on crackers!

full_string.S: 1 small box instant white chocolate pudding

details.S: Mix all together. Make a day ahead. Can use low fat.

name.S: instant vanilla or lemon pudding mix

details.S: Mix well and serve with assorted fresh fruit. Yields: 2 cups.
Fry the sausage; add cheese and tomatoes. Heat until all cheese is melted.
Keep warm in a little crock pot. Serve with corn chips or crackers.

description.S: This is a very creamy and yummy pumpkin dip that is served with graham crackers or ginger cookies.

details.S: In a large bowl, mix together instant vanilla pudding mix, pumpkin and pumpkin pie spice.
Fold in the thawed frozen whipped topping. Store in the refrigerator until serving.

full_string.S: 1 package any flavor Jimmy Dean's sausage
1 package chopped spinach - thawed and drained
2 cups cheddar cheese - shredded (may want to use more)

details.S: Brown sausage. Add softened cream cheese and stir to melt. Add other ingredients and continue on low temperature until warm. Serve with crackers, etc.
Combine all ingredients and beat with an electric mixer until creamy. Serve with fresh strawberries. Great to bring to parties with fresh strawberries.
Put all ingredients in a crock pot until warm. Use the amount of hamburger and taco seasoning as you would like for extra spice. Serve with tortilla chips.
Heat until cheese melts and serve with corn chips.
Mix well the cream cheese, sour cream and taco seasoning with a mixer.
Spread on a serving plate and layer with remaining ingredients, topping off with shredded cheese.

description.S: This recipe is a favorite hot dip recipe that we would have when we would visit one of Patty's friends.

full_string.S: 1 (10 oz package) frozen spinach - thawed and liquid drained
1 (8 oz package) Monterey Jack cheese - shredded

notes.S: cubed (or I would use a can of chopped tomatoes, drained, if I didn't have any tomatoes)

full_string.S: 2 tomatoes - cubed (or I would use a can of chopped tomatoes, drained, if I didn't have any tomatoes)

details.S: Mix and cook at 350° for 20 minutes.

full_string.S: 1 large can chicken - or 1-2 breasts, cut up

details.S: Spread cream cheese into pie plate. In a separate small bowl, mix chicken with a shake of seasoning and Tabasco sauce, to taste; spread over cream cheese.
Pour blue cheese dressing on top, to taste, approximately ¼ cup. Sprinkle with cheese.
Microwave until the cheese is melted.
Chop all vegetables and put in a bowl. Add garlic salt, Ro-Tel tomatoes, and chilies. Mix and refrigerate. Serve with Tostitos.

full_string.S: 1 (8 oz package) cream cheese - room temperature

name.S: sun dried tomatoes packed in oil

full_string.S: 6 tbsp sun dried tomatoes packed in oil - chopped

details.S: Mix all together. Best if you make it several hours early so flavors can blend. Serve with pita chips or crackers.

notes.S: I usually make more, they keep well

full_string.S: 4 (7-inch) flour tortillas - I usually make more, they keep well

notes.S: or your own cinnamon and sugar mixture

full_string.S: ½ tbsp ground cinnamon - or your own cinnamon and sugar mixture
1½ cup strawberries - chopped, I used quick frozen
2 tbsp orange marmalade - apricot preserves, or apple jelly

details.S: Preheat the oven to 400° degrees. For cinnamon chips, lightly spray tortillas with water or Pam spray. Combine sugar and cinnamon in flour/sugar shaker; sprinkle over tortillas. Cut each tortilla into 8 wedges; place in a single layer on round baking stone.
Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp. Remove to cooling rack; cool completely.
For salsa, peel, core, and slice apples. Cut apples into quarters; chop with a food chopper. Slice or dice strawberries and chop kiwi. Place fruit in a 1-quart bowl.
Zest orange and juice until you have about 2 (tbsp) of juice. Add orange zest, orange juice, brown sugar and jelly to the fruit mixture; mix gently.
Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with cinnamon chips.

full_string.S: 1 (8 oz package) cream cheese - room temperature

details.S: Combine cream cheese and blue cheese until smooth and creamy; add cheddar cheese. Spread in a shallow serving bowl. Cover and chill for 1 hour.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir 4-5 minutes until tender. Reduce heat, stir in 1 tsp sugar; cook for 10 minutes. Remove onion from pan.
In the same pan, combine cranberries, ¼ cup sugar and water. Cover and cook for 5 minutes until berries pop and sauce thickens. Stir occasionally. Stir in vinegar and onions. Cool.
Put cranberry/onion mixture on top of cheese mixture. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts. Serve at room temperature. Serve with crackers.
Combine all ingredients; stir until combined well.
Fill greased muffin cups. Bake at 375° for 18-20 minutes.

full_string.S: ½ cup cheddar cheese - shredded, 4 oz
¼ cup margarine or butter - melted

details.S: Heat oven to 450°.
Mix baking mix, milk, and cheese until soft dough forms. Beat vigorously 30 seconds.
Drop dough by spoonful onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
Mix margarine and garlic powder; brush over warm biscuits before removing them from the cookie sheet. Serve warm. Makes 10-12 large biscuits.

name.S: Donna Brunkhorst Litman, In Memory of Erin Delaney

description.S: Sometimes I throw in chocolate chips, which is a delicious variation. However, if you add chocolate chips, you will need to increase the baking time.

details.S: Combine sugar and butter in a bowl. Add bananas and blend well.
Add milk and mix in. Then add soda, salt, and flour. Mix well.
Grease and flour 1 loaf pan. Pour mixture into pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 300°. Grease four 7x3-inch loaf pans.
In a small bowl, stir together ¼ cup sugar and 1 tsp cinnamon; dust pans lightly with sugar and cinnamon mixture.
In a large bowl, cream butter and 3 cups sugar. Mix in eggs, mashed bananas, sour cream, vanilla and cinnamon. Mix in salt, baking soda and flour. Stir in nuts, cranberries or blueberries.
Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes 32 servings.

description.S: Delicious served with soup or salad. I like to take it to potluck meals.

full_string.S: 2 tsp dill seed or 1 (tbsp) dill weed

details.S: Dissolve yeast in ¼ cup warm water. Stir in all ingredients, except flour, then mix in 1½ cup flour and beat 2 minutes. Add remaining flour and mix by hand. Let rise until double.
Pour out. Punch down. Knead a bit and shape into a loaf.
Put in a well-greased loaf pan and let rise until double.
Bake 1 hour at 350°. Serves 8.

description.S: Coffeecake may be assembled the night before to bake in the morning. Lightly cover assembled bread with plastic wrap. Place in the refrigerator to rise overnight. Bake in the morning. Be careful, the risen coffeecake is very fragile and will fall if bumped.

full_string.S: 1 (1 lb loaf) frozen bread dough - white or wheat, thawed

details.S: On a lightly floured surface, roll thawed dough out to fit a 10x15-inch jelly roll pan.
Beat cream cheese with ½ cup sugar in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg and 1 tsp vanilla. Spread over bread dough. Sprinkle with blueberries.
Combine flour and ½ cup sugar in a small bowl. Cut in margarine or butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over blueberries. Let rise in a warm area for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
For glaze, combine all ingredients and mix well. Drizzle bread with glaze.

full_string.S: ½ cup frozen orange juice concentrate

details.S: Cream together margarine and sugar. Add eggs; mix well.
In a medium bowl, mix orange juice and buttermilk together; add soda and mix well. Mixture will foam when soda is added.
Add orange mixture to creamed margarine mixture and blend. Add flour and beat well. Fold in orange segments and nuts.
Pour into 2 greased and floured 4x8-inch loaf pans. Bake 55-60 minutes at 350°.
Combine brown sugar, shortening, egg, and buttermilk. Sift in dry ingredients, mix well. Stir in vanilla, rhubarb, and nuts.
Pour batter into 2 greased loaf pans (I use Pam). Sprinkle with topping.
Bake at 350° for 45-50 minutes. Let cool 20 minutes to ½ hour before turning out of the pan.
Preheat the oven to 350°. Lightly grease two 9x5-inch loaf pans.
In a microwave safe bowl, microwave chocolate until melted. Stir occasionally until chocolate is smooth.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, sugar, oil, grated zucchini, vanilla and chocolate; beat well. Stir in flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Fold in chocolate chips.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pans. Bake in a preheated oven for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a loaf comes out clean.
Combine flour, sugar, pudding mix, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, oil, lemon juice and extract. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in zucchini, poppy seeds and lemon peel.
Pour into two greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pans. Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans to cool completely.

full_string.S: 2 cups unpeeled zucchini - shredded, well drained
1 (8½ oz can) crushed pineapple - well drained

details.S: Preheat the oven to 350°.
Mix eggs, oil and sugar. Blend in flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and nutmeg. Add vanilla, zucchini and pineapple. Stir in nuts and dates.
Pour in 2 greased 5x9x3-inch loaf pans. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. Test with a toothpick. May take 15 minutes more.
Cool slightly in pan and then remove from pan. Cool on a wire rack. Let cool completely before slicing. Wrap in foil and refrigerate.
Combine ingredients. Pour into 2 greased and floured loaf pans. Bake 1 hour in a 350° oven.
Heat oven to 350°.
Beat eggs, sugar, oil and vanilla until smooth, about 3 minutes. Beat in cream cheese.
Add remaining ingredients. Fold in nuts and zucchini.
Divide batter into 2 greased and floured 9x5-inch loaf pans. Bake for 60 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Freezes well.
Sprinkle pecans in the bottom of a 9x13-inch greased pan. Lay frozen rolls on top. Sprinkle butterscotch pudding on top.
Boil margarine and brown sugar together. Pour on top of the above.
Cover with Saran Wrap or buttered foil. Leave on the counter overnight. Bake at 350° for ½ hour.
Mix together eggs, cake mix, and apple cinnamon pie filling with an electric mixer.
Pour into a 9x13-inch pan. Mix together brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon and sprinkle on cake.
Bake at 350° for 35-40 minutes.

description.S: May skip the refrigeration step and reduce baking time. You can also do all of the preparation ahead of time, refrigerate overnight, and bake the next day.

details.S: Mix together cream cheese, ½ cup sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla.
Roll bread slices flat with a rolling pin. Spread bread with cream cheese mixture. Roll up as for a jelly roll. Refrigerate overnight.
Cut rolls in half crosswise. Mix ¾ cup sugar and cinnamon.
Dip rolls in melted margarine and then roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Bake on greased cookie sheets for 20-25 minutes at 350°.

full_string.S: ¼ cup margarine or butter - melted

details.S: Heat oven to 375°.
Combine sugar, flour, and cinnamon. Separate dough into 16 triangles.

Dip 1 marshmallow in margarine; roll in sugar mixture. Place marshmallow on the wide end of the triangle and roll to the opposite point. Completely cover marshmallow with dough; firmly pinch edges to seal.
Dip 1 end in remaining margarine; place margarine-side down in an ungreased large muffin cup. Repeat with remaining marshmallows.
Bake 12-15 minutes until golden brown.

description.S: Great when frosted with Creamy Caramel Frosting.

details.S: Boil potatoes in salted water. Drain potatoes and save water.
Add ¼ cup flour, ¼ cup white sugar, and dry yeast to 1 cup potato water. Mix well and set aside to rise.
Mix mashed potatoes, the rest of the sugar, butter, milk, eggs, 1 cup flour, and salt. Add raised yeast mixture.
Add 4-6 cups flour until dough is not sticky. Knead dough, and cover to let rise in a warm spot.
Roll out dough to ½ inch thick.Spread with melted butter, cinnamon, and brown sugar. Roll up and cut every 2 inches.
Put into a greased pan to let rise again.
Bake for 25 minutes at 350°. Frost when cooled.

description.S: Yield: 2 dozen rolls.

details.S: Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water. Add salt, sugar, melted margarine, and eggs. Beat well with an electric mixer. Add flour gradually.
Knead well. Let rise until it doubles in size.
Shape into rolls or make cinnamon rolls.
Mix brown sugar and cream in the bottom of a 9x13-inch ungreased pan.
Place rolls on top of the mixture. Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes.
Immediately invert the pan on the serving plate after removing from the oven.

description.S: These were Jennifer Brunkhorst's favorites.

full_string.S: 1 (3 oz package) butterscotch pudding - cooked type

details.S: Place frozen rolls in a single layer in a bundt pan. Sprinkle dry pudding over rolls.
Mix together remaining ingredients, and pour over rolls and pudding. Let stand overnight in a cold oven.
In the morning, bake for 35-40 minutes.
Let set for approximately 5-10 minutes. Invert onto a serving platter.
Scald milk; take from heat and add margarine. Set aside until lukewarm.
Meanwhile, add yeast to lukewarm water; set aside.
When the milk mixture is lukewarm, add ½ - ¾ cup sugar and salt, yeast mixture and several cups of flour (about 3).

Using a large mixing spoon, beat together well. Add enough flour to make dough stiff enough to knead. Try not to get it too stiff. Knead on pastry cloth or floured board. Let rise in a warm room until double in bulk.

Knead down and make into hamburger buns - about 12 or 15 on a large cookie sheet or jelly roll pan. I usually make 12 on a pan. Be sure to flatten them as much as possible before they start to rise. Let rise until light.
Gently, with a forefinger, press the centers down, hole about the size of a quarter.
Put about a teaspoon of your favorite jam in the center (apricot jam with a little lemon juice in it is good); can also use ½ cooked prunes or pureed apricots.

Bake in a moderate oven until light brown. Take out of the oven and while hot, frost with a powdered sugar frosting made with lemon juice and butter or margarine. Frosting shouldn't be too thick, and it will melt over the rolls like a glaze.
Blend eggs, sugar and margarine. Add bananas.
Mix milk, soda; add flour. Pour into a lined muffin pan.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes.

notes.S: 1 pkg. = 4 tsp, I use rapid rise

full_string.S: 5 level tsp yeast - 1 pkg. = 4 tsp, I use rapid rise
5½ cup flour - may need ¼ cup more

notes.S: prunes or raisins will do, diced

full_string.S: 1 cup dates - prunes or raisins will do, diced

details.S: In a large bowl, KitchenAid, or bread maker, put yeast and add warm milk. Add sugar, oil, spices, some of the flour, prunes or dates, and then eggs.
Knead for 5 minutes, dough should not be sticky.
Put in a greased bowl and turn to coat. Let rise, covered, in a warm place until doubled; 1 hour for regular yeast, ½ hour for rapid rise.
Punch dough down. Roll into 2 large loafs for coffeecake or 1 large and 3 small ones. Can shape them or "U" shape them or put them in a circle.Let rise again for 25 minutes.
Put the oven at 250° and put them in; after about 10 minutes, turn the temperature up to 325°, and bake for about 20 minutes for large. Don't let the bottom get too brown.
Let cool, then ice with powdered sugar frosting; dust lightly with cinnamon. Serve warm!

name.S: George and Rosaline Schumacher, In Memory of Berniece Schumacher

description.S: Makes 12.

details.S: Combine Bran Flakes and milk. Let stand about 2 minutes or until moisture is mostly absorbed.
Add egg and shortening; beat well. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Combine with Bran Flake mixture.
Put into muffin pans. Bake at 350°.
Heat oven to 350°. Line 36 muffin cups with paper baking cups.
Combine dry ingredients. Add apples, carrots, coconut, raisins and nuts. Mix well.
Add oil, milk, vanilla and eggs; stir just until moistened.
Fill lined or greased muffin cups ¾ full.
Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the muffin comes out clean. Immediately remove from pans.
To freeze muffins, cool completely. Place in large plastic freezer bags; freeze up to 1 month.
Combine brown sugar, flour, and chopped pecans.
In a separate bowl, mix butter and eggs together; then stir into flour ingredients until just moistened.
Fill greased and floured muffin tin or foil-lined miniature muffin tins ⅔ full. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove immediately to cool on a wire rack.

full_string.S: ¾ cup orange juice or buttermilk

details.S: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, soda and nuts.
Separately combine egg, oil and orange juice or buttermilk; add to dry ingredients. Stir until moistened. Add rhubarb.
Pour into muffin tins. Bake at 375° for 25-30 minutes. I like to add ½ tsp nutmeg.

description.S: Makes 24 muffins.

full_string.S: 1 (16 oz can) pumpkin - not pie mix

details.S: In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, sugar, pumpkin and oil until smooth.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt; add to pumpkin mixture and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips.
Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups ¾ full. Bake at 400° for 16-20 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing.

description.S: Great served on baking powder biscuits, bagels, French toast, waffles, etc.

full_string.S: 1 (10 oz package) frozen sweetened sliced strawberries (thawed - drained)

details.S: Cream butter until light and fluffy. Gradually add confectioners' (powdered) sugar. Slowly add strawberries to the creamed mixture. Beat well.

description.S: Bananas do not discolor in this mixture. Can add sliced apples. Can substitute frozen strawberries or can use raspberries. Yields about 16 servings.

name.S: pineapple chunks with        juice (can use crushed or tidbits)

full_string.S: 1 (20 oz can) pineapple chunks with juice (can use crushed or tidbits)
1 (11 oz can) mandarin oranges with juice

When the surface is bubbly, flip cakes. Cook until lightly brown. These are not thick and doughy or dry, but just right!

Fry in a frying pan with a small amount of melted butter or oil.

details.S: Unroll and separate dough into triangles. Place in a 9-inch pie pan or 9-inch quiche pan, pressing pieces together to form a crust.

Crack 2 eggs into the bag, no more than 2 eggs in each bag. Shake to combine them. Put in chosen ingredients and shake. Make sure to get all the air out of the bag and zip it up.
Place bags in a pan of rolling, boiling water for exactly 13 minutes. Can usually cook 6-8 bags at one time, depending on the size of the kettle.
Remove from the kettle, open the bags and the omelet will fall out. Fun family activity!

Bake 30-45 minutes at 350°.

name.S: Cooked Frosting-out Of This World Icing

Beat butter, shortening, sugar and vanilla. Slowly add cooled flour mixture. Beat until fluffy. Frost.
Cook milk, flour and salt until thick. Let cool.
Beat butter or margarine for 4 minutes. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat 4 minutes more.
Add cooled flour mixture and beat 4 more minutes.
Cream butter or margarine. Add cocoa and powdered sugar alternately with milk; beat to spreading consistency. Blend in vanilla.
Cream the cream cheese and butter until fluffy. Add cocoa and vanilla.
Slowly mix in confectioners' sugar until the frosting is smooth. Spread over cooled
cake.

water (more or less depending on desired consistency)

details.S: Mix all ingredients together at once. The longer you beat this the better it is to work with.
Double the recipe for sheet cake size. This keeps well in the refrigerator and may be frozen. Keep tightly covered. To color, it's best to use paste color instead of liquid.

Add ½ (cup) powdered sugar at a time. Beat until smooth and creamy. Add milk if too thick, 1 (tsp) at a time. Great on cinnamon rolls!
Mix ingredients in the order given. Beat on high until light and fluffy. Fill cupcakes with a cake decorator bag. Frost cupcakes following.

name.S: Great Grandma Dell's Angel Food Cake

description.S: The most delicious angel food cake I have ever tasted has been handed down in my family for four generations. I call it my "Great Grandma Dell's Angel FoodCake." My great grandma Della learned to make this special angel food cake from her mother, my great-great grandma Anna, who lived in Austria. My great grandma Della loved to prepare and eat this tasty cake. Great Grandma Della was raised in a small farming town in Masonville, Iowa. She had fresh eggs from the chickens and milk from the cows that she raised on her farm. The angel food cake recipe is a favorite of mine because when I make the cake with my Grandma, she shares stories about the times when she and her mother used to make this recipe. I like to watch my Grandma crack open the twelve eggs for the cake. Sometimes she lets me crack them. The cake is used mainly on birthdays. I love the smell of the cake cooking. It reminds me of all the happy birthdays we have celebrated. I like the fluffy cake with chocolate ice cream.This recipe and story was written by Annamae Fabric's granddaughter, Alexandra Matloff, daughter of Natalie Fabric Matloff, as an English project, November 1999.

details.S: This mouth-watering angel food cake is made by first, combining the sifted flour with ¾ (cup) sugar and sifting four times. Then, while the oven is preheating at 375", beat together the egg whites, cream of tartar, salt and flavorings until soft peaks form.

Next, add the remaining ¾ (cup) of sugar, 2 (tbsp) at a time, beating the mixture after each addition of sugar. The flour and sugar combination is then folded in very, very gently and carefully. After pouring the mixture into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan, the mixture is baked at 375° for 35-40 minutes.

Finally, remove the cake and turn it upside down in the pan onto a large Coke bottle. In about 1½ hours, the cake will be cool. The cake is removed from the pan by running a sharp knife along the sides. Now you are ready to enjoy the most wonderful and sweetest dessert this side of heaven.

name.S: pkg. one-step angel food cake mix

details.S: Combine the pumpkin and seasonings. Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Fold in ¼ of the batter into the pumpkin mixture. Gently fold in remaining batter.
Gently, spoon into an ungreased 10-inch tube pan. Cut through batter with a knife to remove air pockets.
Bake on the lowest rack at 350° for 39-44 minutes or until the top is golden brown and cake springs back when lightly touched.
Immediately invert the pan onto a wire rack; cool completely, about 1 hour. Serve with whipped topping, sprinkle with cinnamon.

Add 1 container of prepared frosting, using flavor that coordinates with cake. (German chocolate, coconut pecan frosting, lemon cake, lemon frosting, carrot with cream cheese frosting, etc.). Stir cake and frosting together.
Form into balls and freeze.
Dip balls into melted almond bark. Keep refrigerated.
