and baking powder to the creamed mixture and mix well.
Roll out dough between waxed paper into a 12-inch square. Remove the top piece of waxed paper. Spread dough with strawberry jam and sprinkle with nuts. Roll up tightly jelly roll style,
starting with the long side. Wrap in plastic wrap.
Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm.
Unwrap dough and cut into ¼ inch slices. Place on an ungreased baking pan.
Bake at 375° for 9-12 minutes. Remove to cool.

description.S: Makes 2 dozen. Can double the recipe for a larger batch.

full_string.S: ¾ cup crunchy or creamy peanut butter

details.S: Put sugar, syrup and peanut butter in a pan and mix. On high heat, bring mixture to boil.
When full boil is reached, take off the stove (less than 1 minute). Add cereal or pour over cereal in a greased bowl. Mix lightly.
Drop by tablespoonful onto waxed paper.

description.S: Recipe submitted by Patty's sister Pam Morales and also by Monica Piersall, Patty's aunt.

details.S: Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each. Stir in vanilla. Gradually mix dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
Chill dough thoroughly, 3-4 hours.
On a well-floured surface, roll dough ⅛ inch thick. Cut out with cutters.
Bake on an ungreased cookie sheet in a 375° oven for 6-8 minutes.
Cool on rack. Frost with powdered sugar frosting.

name.S: Monica Piersall, Pam and Patty's aunt

details.S: Frost cookies when cool.

description.S: I don't know if this was Patty's frosting recipe, but it was one in my recipe box on a recipe card that said "from the recipe file of Patty McFadden," so it's been around awhile!!!

details.S: Mix powdered sugar and egg white. Beat until smooth.
In a saucepan, combine water, sugar and salt; boil 1 minute. Pour hot mixture over sugar and egg white.
Blend well; add shortening and flavoring, beat while adding and continue to beat until smooth and creamy.
Mix in order and roll out. Cut in shapes, sprinkle with sugar if not frosting.
Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.

description.S: This was a favorite cookie made by my dad, Philip and his family throughout the summer.

details.S: Mix well the first 3 ingredients. Bring the last 3 ingredients to a boil.
Combine the 2 mixtures immediately and drop by teaspoon on waxed paper. Let set until cool.

description.S: Makes        2-3 dozen.

details.S: Preheat the oven to 350°.
Cream together butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the creamed mixture. Put in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Separate the chilled dough into 3 or 4 sections. Use a rolling pin to flatten to a ¼ inch thickness. Cut into shapes.
Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 5-8 minutes until golden brown.

description.S: Great with Cream Cheese Frosting.

name.S: soda dissolved in ¾ (cup) cold water

full_string.S: ¼ tsp soda dissolved in ¾ (cup) cold water

details.S: Grease a 10x15-inch jelly roll pan.
Put all ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Mix just enough until all ingredients are blended. Do not over beat.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Place all ingredients in a large bowl. Beat at speed 2 to start; then speed 3 for 3 minutes.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes in an 8x8-inch pan, greased on the bottom only.
Serve with ice cream. Quick and easy.
Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla; add sifted dry ingredients and nut meats. Spread in a greased 10x15-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cover with miniature marshmallows. Return to the oven for 3 minutes.
Combine brown sugar, chocolate and water; boil together for 3 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla. Add powdered sugar (enough to make spreading consistency).
Spread over marshmallows.
Melt butter and cocoa in a 2-quart pan; remove from heat.
Add sugar, flour, vanilla and eggs, 1 at a time.
Spray or grease a 9x13-inch pan and pour brownies into a pan.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or longer if you want cake-like.
Bring the first 3 ingredients to a boil.
Mix dry ingredients and eggs in a separate bowl. Add heated ingredients, stir with mixer thoroughly.
Bake in a sprayed jelly roll pan. Bake at 350° for 20-22 minutes.
Bring butter, cocoa and buttermilk to a boil for 2-3 minutes.
Add 1 (lb) powdered sugar or more as needed.
In a saucepan, combine caramels and ⅓ (cup) evaporated milk. Cook over low heat, stirring until caramels are melted.
Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, butter, ⅓ (cup) evaporated milk and nuts. By hand, stir until dough holds together.
Press ½ of the dough into the pan. Bake for 6 minutes at 350°.
Sprinkle chocolate chips over baked crust, spread caramel mixture over chocolate chips. Crumble remaining dough over caramel mixture.
Return to the oven, and bake for 15-18 minutes.
Cool slightly; then refrigerate to set caramels, 1 hour. Cut into squares.

description.S: Makes 12-15 servings.

full_string.S: 1 (12 oz) box Rice Krispies (10 cups. - divided)

details.S: Place caramels, sweetened condensed  milk and butter in a bowl and microwave for 3 minutes. Stir until smooth, returning to microwave if not yet melted; set aside to cool.
In another bowl, melt 6 (tbsp) of butter with 4 (cups) marshmallows for 70 seconds. Stir until smooth and then pour over 5 cups of the cereal; stir until cereal is coated.
Place in a greased 9x13-inch glass dish. Sprinkle 2 (cups) miniature marshmallows on top of cereal mixture. Carefully pour caramel mixture over marshmallows; refrigerate to set up.
Repeat the second layer of rice cereal mixture, using the rest of the butter, marshmallows and cereal.
Place the second layer of Rice Krispies mixture on top of the caramel layer; chill until firm.
Mix flour, sugar and butter until crumbly. Press into a 9x13-inch pan.
Bake for 20 minutes at 350° or until lightly browned.
Blend eggs, brown sugar, salt, baking powder and vanilla. Add cut-up cherries, coconut and nuts.
Spread egg mixture over crust. Bake for another 25 minutes.
Mix powdered sugar and butter. Add cherry juice to mix and vanilla.

name.S: In memory of Patty McFadden Hertog, by sister Pam Morales and aunt Monica Piersall

details.S: Melt chips, milk, salt and butter in a double boiler.
Add nuts and vanilla. Cool.
Cream butter and sugar. Mix in eggs and vanilla. Sift salt, flour and soda.
Add oatmeal. Add dry ingredients to the creamed mixture.
Spread ⅔ of dough in a large brownie pan, cover with filling. Dot with remaining dough.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes.

description.S: Makes 3 dozen bars.

full_string.S: ½ cup light brown sugar ¼ (tsp) salt

name.S: Nestle Toll House semisweet chocolate morsels (divided)

full_string.S: 1 (12 oz package) Nestle Toll House semisweet chocolate morsels (divided)
1 (14 oz can) Nestle Carnation sweetened condensed milk

details.S: Preheat the oven to 350°. Grease a 13x9-inch baking pan.
Beat butter in a large mixer bowl until creamy. Beat in flour, sugar and salt until crumbly.
With floured fingers, press 1¾ (cup) flour mixture onto bottom of prepared baking pan; reserve
remaining mixture.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.

Microwave 1 (cup) morsels and sweetened condensed milk in a medium, uncovered, microwave-safe bowl on high (100%) power for 1 minute; stir. Morsels may retain some of their original shape. If necessary, microwave in additional 10-15 second intervals, stirring just until morsels are melted. Spread over hot crust.
Stir the nuts into the reserved flour mixture; sprinkle over the chocolate layer. Drop teaspoonsful of raspberry jam over flour mixture. Sprinkle with 1 (cup) remaining morsels.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the center is set.
Cool in a pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

description.S: ½ (cup) corn syrup

name.S: I use peanut and plain M&M's and salted peanuts.

full_string.S: I use peanut and plain M&M's and salted peanuts.

details.S: (cup) brown sugar
(cup) butter
½(tsp) vanilla
egg
(cups) flour
(tbsp) butter
(6 oz package) butterscotch chips
½-2½ (cup) assorted candies*
Preheat the oven to 350°. Use a 9x13-inch pan.
Mix together butter, brown sugar, vanilla and egg. Add flour; spread into pan.
Bake for 20 minutes. Cool.
Heat syrup, butter and butterscotch chips over low heat until melted. Pour over baked crust.
Sprinkle with candies and nuts.
Mix until crumbly the cake mixes, eggs and oil. Reserve 1½ (cup) of mixture. Put the remainder of crumbs into an ungreased bar pan.
Bake for 15 minutes at 350°.
Beat softened cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice and eggs. Spread over the baked layer. Sprinkle with reserved crumbs.
Bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar when cool.
Combine flour, oatmeal, sugar, soda and salt. Add margarine and mix until moistened.
Press ⅔ of mix in a 9x3-inch cake pan. Bake the crust for 10 minutes at 325°.
Mix peanut butter and sweetened condensed milk until well blended. Pour over baked crust. Top with chips and M&M's. Top with remaining crust mixture.
Bake for 15-20 minutes at 350° or until golden brown.
Mix ingredients in order given in a large mixing bowl. Press into a greased 10x15-inch jelly roll pan.
Bake for 15-20 minutes at 350°. Do not over bake.

name.S: In memory of Patty McFadden Hertog by sister, Pam Morales

description.S: Tip: If desired, ¾ (cup) caramel ice cream topping with 3 (tbsp) flour may be substituted for melted caramel mixture.

full_string.S: 5 tbsp evaporated milk or light cream

details.S: In a double boiler, melt caramels and milk. Cool slightly.
Combine the rest of the ingredients, except chips and pecans, in a large bowl.
Press half of the crumbs into the bottom of an 11x7-inch pan or jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350° for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, and sprinkle with chips and pecans.
Spread carefully with caramel mixture. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, and chill 1-2 hours.
Mix all ingredients with an electric mixer until well blended. Pour mixture into a jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.
Cream together the cream cheese and margarine. Add powdered sugar gradually, alternately with milk.
Combine flour, cinnamon, cloves and baking soda in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, beat butter and sugars until creamy.
Beat in pumpkin, egg and vanilla until blended; gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in 1½ (cup) white chips and the nuts.
Spread into a greased 15x10-inch jelly roll pan. Bake at 350° for 18-22 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack.
Melt remaining chips in the microwave on medium, stirring every 15 seconds until melted. Drizzle over bars.
Cook sugar and syrup over medium heat until mixture boils; remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter, mix in Rice Krispies.
Press into a buttered 9x13-inch pan. Let it harden.
For a special treat, melt chocolate and butterscotch chips; stir well and spread over cereal mixture.
Chill until the top is firm. Cut into bars.

name.S: La Verne and Pat Schumacher and family

description.S: Yield: 3 dozen.

name.S: fresh rhubarb (finely chopped) or frozen rhubarb (thawed

full_string.S: 5 cups fresh rhubarb (finely chopped) or frozen rhubarb (thawed - drained)

details.S: In a bowl, combine flour and sugar; cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, for filling, combine sugar and flour in a bowl. Whisk in cream and eggs. Stir in the rhubarb.
Pour over the crust. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until custard is set. Cool.
For topping, in a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until smooth; fold in whipped cream.
Spread over top. Cover and chill. Cut into bars. Store in the refrigerator.
Press cookie dough in a jelly roll pan. Bake at 350° until light brown.
Melt caramels, margarine and milk in a microwave or double boiler.
Pour over cooled cookie dough. Cool.
Melt chocolate chips and peanut butter. Spread over caramel. Cool.
Cream sugar, oil and eggs together. Then add flour, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, baking powder, vanilla and cocoa. Beat together 1-2 minutes until well mixed.
Fold in and mix well the shredded zucchini, carrot, oatmeal and walnuts.
Bake in a greased jelly roll pan at 350° for 15-20 minutes.
Frost with cream cheese frosting. Enjoy!

name.S: In Memory of Patty McFadden Hertog and Mary Jo McFadden by Vince McFadden

description.S: Serves 2 McFaddens. Also submitted by Pam (Brunkhorst) French, niece to Mary Jo.

details.S: Mix sugar, milk, chocolate chips and butter and boil for 8 minutes. After boiling for 8 minutes, add vanilla and let cool.
Soften vanilla ice cream. Crush Oreos and mix with melted butter. Spread in a
9x13-inch pan and put in the refrigerator to set up for a while.
Put Spanish peanuts on crust if desired and then ice cream and then topping. Freeze it.
Spread bread pieces evenly in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon and raisins.
Combine ½ quart milk, 3 eggs, 3 (tbsp) butter, 2 (cups) sugar and vanilla. Pour over bread and bake for 1 hour at 350°.
Combine all remaining ingredients together and heat until boiling. Then add 4 (tbsp) whiskey. Pour this over baked pudding.
Serve this over baked custard. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

description.S: Grandpa Moeller's favorite dessert!

details.S: Bring sugar, water, pineapple and Jello to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Chill until set. (About 2 hours-looks rubbery.)
Fold in Cool Whip. Slice cake crosswise into 3 layers.
Spread filling between layers and then cover top and sides. If you have excess filling, fill the cake hole, otherwise it can fill with tiny marshmallows.
Freeze. To freeze, put into the freezer, uncovered, until the topping has hardened. Then cover with plastic wrap or foil.
Serve cake directly from the freezer. Keeps in the freezer for a long time.

name.S: In memory of my mom, Mae Brunkhorst, by Patricia Maas

description.S: Serves 6.

details.S: Roll graham crackers. Mix softened butter with the graham cracker crumbs. Spread in a 9-inch square pan. Save ½ (cup) of crumbs to sprinkle on top.
Whip the whipping cream; add sugar and vanilla. Mix with small marshmallows. Place ½ of this mixture on top of the crust.
Add cherry pie filling. Spread remainder of cream topping on top. Add crumbs.

description.S: Makes 12 servings.

full_string.S: ½ cup caramel ice cream topping

details.S: Combine chocolate crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 10 minutes. Cool slightly.
In a heavy bottom medium size pan, melt caramels and caramel ice cream topping over low heat, stirring often. Stir in first ¼ (cup) whipping cream.
Remove from heat; stir in nuts. Spread over the crust.
Cool, cover and chill for 1 hour.
In a heavy small saucepan, melt chocolate. Remove from heat; stir in remaining whipping cream.
Drizzle or spread over caramel-pecan mixture. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour.
Beat eggs with sugar. Break in pieces of cream cheese; beat until smooth. Add vanilla.
Place 16 cupcake papers (foil is best) in muffin tins. Drop 1 vanilla wafer in the bottom of each tin. Fill ¾ full with cream cheese mixture.
Bake in a 375° oven for 10-12 minutes. They will look pale and sunken after cooking.
Top with a spoonful of cherries after they have cooled.
Mix together; pat into bottom of a 9x13-inch glass pan.
Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
Cream the first 3 ingredients together. Top with whipped topping.
Spread over the bottom of the cooled crust.
Beat pudding and milk until stiff. Spread over cream cheese mixture.
Spread Cool Whip over pudding. (Usually takes a 12 oz carton of Cool Whip.)
Grate the Hershey bars over the topping and sprinkle the peanuts over that.
Put into the freezer for 2 hours, then refrigerate.

description.S: This is a very quick, tasty dessert.

name.S: pie shell (baked) or pie shell of your choice

full_string.S: 1 (9-inch) pie shell (baked) or pie shell of your choice

name.S: About 4 oz Cool whip or whipped cream

full_string.S: About 4 oz Cool whip or whipped cream

details.S: Blend cream cheese, milk and sour cream together with a mixer. Add instant pudding and Cool Whip.
Pour in pie shell; top with cherry pie filling. It can be served after chilling for about 30 minutes.

name.S: LaVerne and Pat Schumacher and family

description.S: Yield: 14-16 servings.

details.S: In a bowl, combine wafers, almonds and sugar; add butter and mix well. Press into the bottom of an ungreased 10-inch springform pan; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until creamy. Add eggs, 1 at a time,
beating well after each addition. Add extracts; beat just until blended.
Pour into the crust. Bake at 350° for 55 minutes or until the center is almost set.
Remove from the oven; let stand for 5 minutes.
Combine sour cream, sugar and vanilla; spread over filling. Return to the oven for 5 minutes. Cool on a wire rack; chill overnight.
Just before serving, sprinkle with almonds and remove the sides of the pan. Store in the refrigerator.
Preheat the oven to 300°. Line cupcake pans with cupcake papers (foil work best). Place 1 Oreo in the bottom of each paper.
Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add condensed milk, eggs and vanilla.
In a small bowl, toss ½ (cup) chocolate chips with flour; stir into cheese mixture.
Fill each cup ¾ full. Sprinkle ½ (tsp) chips over each.
Bake for 19 minutes. Cool at room temperature; then chill.
servings.
Heat oven to 325°. In a medium bowl, combine crust ingredients. Mix well and press into the bottom and 1 inch up on sides of an ungreased 10-inch springform pan.
Beat cream cheese in a large bowl until smooth. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add sugar and almond extract; beat until smooth. Add ½ (cup) whipping cream. Blend well.

Spoon 3½ (cup) cream mixture into crust. Spread evenly. Carefully spoon 1 (cup) pie filling over cream cheese mixture. (Reserve the rest of the pie filling for garnish.) Spoon remaining cream cheese mixture evenly over pie filling.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour 5 minutes to 1 hour 15 minutes or until the center is set. Cool for 1 hour.
Bring ½ (cup) whipping cream to a boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate chips, stir until melted.
Line a plate with waxed paper; remove sides of the springform pan. Pour glaze over the cooled cake, allowing it to flow over the sides.
Refrigerate 3 hours before serving. Garnish with remaining cherries.

description.S: Awesome! Makes 12-14 servings.

details.S: In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, 2 (tbsp) granulated sugar, melted butter, coconut and pecans.
Press into the bottom and ½ inch up the side of a 9-inch springform pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 8-10 minutes. Cool slightly.
In a saucepan, melt the chocolate over low heat. Remove from heat; cool.
For filling, in a large bowl, beat together cream cheese, ¾ (cup) granulated sugar, sour cream and vanilla. Add flour and beat well. Add eggs and cooled chocolate; beat until just combined.
Turn the filling into the cooled crust. Bake in a 375° oven for 45-50 minutes or until the center appears nearly set when you shake it. Cool 15 minutes.
Loosen the side of the cheesecake from the side of the pan. Cool 30 minutes. Remove the side of the pan.
Spread the Coconut-Pecan Topping over the cheesecake. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to 24 hours.
In a small saucepan, melt butter; stir in brown sugar, light cream or Half-and-Half and corn syrup.
Cook and stir over medium heat until bubbly. Stir in coconut, chopped pecans and vanilla.
Remove from heat; cool for 5 minutes. Spread over partially cooled cheesecake.

description.S: Crust will be bubbly so the name Moon Cake was given.

details.S: Bring water and margarine to a boil. Add flour slowly, stirring until it forms a ball.
Remove from heat; cool 5-10 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each one. Mixture will be thick.
Spoon and spread into the bottom of a 10x15-inch cookie sheet pan. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes. Batter will form up the sides of the pan during baking.
Mix together cream cheese, milk and pudding until thick. Spread on top of cooled puff crust.
Wait 15 minutes; then spread Cool Whip on top. Drizzle chocolate fudge topping on top.
Refrigerate.
Combine eggs, milk, sugar and vanilla. Beat until well combined but not foamy.
Place four 6 oz custard cups or one 3½ (cup) souffle‚ dish in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish on an oven rack. Pour egg mixture into custard cups or dishes. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Pour boiling water into the baking dish around the cups or dishes to a depth of 1 inch.
Bake in a 325° oven for 30-45 minutes for custard cups (50-60 minutes for a dish) or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

name.S: La Verne and Pat Schumacher and family

description.S: Yield: 12-16 servings.

details.S: Drain pineapple, reserving ¾ (cup) juice. In a saucepan, combine sugar and cornstarch. Add pineapple juice, orange juice and lemon juice.
Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly; cook and stir 1 minute longer.
Remove from heat; set aside.
In a bowl, combine pineapple chunks, oranges, apples and bananas. Pour warm sauce over the fruit; stir gently to coat. Cover and refrigerate.

notes.S: mandarin oranges, grapes, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, kiwi, pineapple, etc.)

full_string.S: Fruit (strawberries - mandarin oranges, grapes, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, kiwi, pineapple, etc.)

details.S: Press dough to cover a lightly sprayed 14-inch pizza pan. Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes or until lightly brown.
Cream cheese, sugar and flavorings until light and fluffy. Fold in Cool Whip. Spread on crust.
Arrange fruit in colorful designs. Chill.

full_string.S: 1 (8 oz) tube refrigerated crescent roll dough

details.S: Separate crescent dough into 8 triangles. Press onto a greased 12-inch pizza pan; seal seams.
Bake at 375° for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are golden. Cool slightly on a wire rack.
Beat cream cheese, sugar and extract until smooth. Spread over the crust. Top with pie filling.
In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, butter and cinnamon. Spread over filling. Top with almonds.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Refrigerate leftovers.

Cut white sugar, brown sugar and flour into margarine as for pie dough. Reserve 1 (cup) mixture for top. Add egg, sour cream, soda and vanilla to the remainder of the crumbs. Mix well with a mixer and pour into a 9x13-inch pan.
Sprinkle 1 (cup) crumbs over the top. Smash 6 Heath bars and sprinkle over the crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Can serve like bars or serve warm with whipped topping.

description.S: Makes 1 gallon. This was Grandpa Moeller's favorite! Just like Culver's! Grandpa Moeller's is Katie Brunkhorst Weigel 's grandpa.

details.S: Heat 2 (cups) cream with milk in the top of a double boiler. Beat eggs slightly. Add sweetened condensed milk, sugar and salt. Blend in a little hot cream and then slowly add to the mixture in the double boiler.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring to 176° or just until the mixture coats the spoon. Cool.
Stir in vanilla and remaining cream.
Freeze in an ice cream freezer using ice and coarse salt mixture.
Omit 1 quart cream. Melt 6 (1 oz) squares of chocolate in a double boiler.
Blend in ½ (cup) additional sugar. Slowly stir in 1 (cup) boiling water. Add to the cooked base.

full_string.S: Chocolate graham crackers (broken in halves - plain can be used too)

name.S: gal. any flavor ice cream (chocolate is best

full_string.S: 1 gal. any flavor ice cream (chocolate is best - softened)

details.S: Spread softened ice cream in a jelly roll pan or cake pan. Spread evenly and about 1-2 inches high. Put in the freezer to refreeze.

When solid, cut ice cream into squares a little bit smaller than a graham cracker square. With cookie spatula, remove and put into the middle of two graham crackers. Wrap in plastic wrap or waxed paper.
Put individual sandwiches in the freezer. Eat whenever.
Melt butter. Add flour and pecans, if desired.
Spread on a 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 15 minutes and then cool.
Mix together 1 carton Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar; spread on crust. Mix together pudding and milk; pour on top of cream cheese mixture.
Top with the 2nd carton of Cool Whip. Refrigerate.

name.S: In memory of Berniece and Chris Schumacher by George and Rosaline Schumacher
instant vanilla pudding and pie filling*

full_string.S: 1 (4 serving size package) instant vanilla pudding and pie filling*

notes.S: you can also choose from coconut cream, lemon or French vanilla. Instead of crushed pineapple you may use a 17 oz can fruit cocktail, pitted dark sweet cherries, diced apricot halves or any other fruit.

full_string.S: Instead of vanilla pudding - you can also choose from coconut cream, lemon or French vanilla. Instead of crushed pineapple you may use a 17 oz can fruit cocktail, pitted dark sweet cherries, diced apricot halves or any other fruit.

details.S: Put the pudding in a bowl, combine with crushed pineapple and mix in prepared topping.

notes.S: crush, reserving ¼-⅓ (cup) crumbs for topping)

full_string.S: 1 small pkg. Oreo cookies (any flavor - crush, reserving ¼-⅓ (cup) crumbs for topping)
2 small packages instant chocolate or vanilla pudding

details.S: Mix Oreo cookie crumbs (all but ¼-⅓ (cup)) with melted margarine and put into a 9x13-inch pan.
Mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip and spread over the crust. Mix pudding with milk. Spread over the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with reserved cookie crumbs.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

name.S: pkg. vanilla cake mix with pudding

full_string.S: 1 pkg. vanilla cake mix with pudding

details.S: Mix canned pumpkin, evaporated milk, eggs, sugar and spice together and pat into a greased 9x13-inch glass baking dish.
Sprinkle cake mix over pumpkin mixture. Top with nuts. Pour butter over nuts.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350° for 50-60 minutes. Refrigerate. Serve with whipped cream.

description.S: Optional: If using raspberry Jello, add ½ (tsp) almond flavoring to the cheese layer.

full_string.S: 1 (6 oz package) raspberry or strawberry Jello
1 (10 oz package) frozen raspberries or strawberries

details.S: Mix pretzels, margarine and sugar together. Press in a 9x13-inch pan and bake at 400° for 10 minutes.
Beat together cream cheese, sugar and Cool Whip and spread over the cooled pretzel layer.
Mix Jello and boiling water; stirring until dissolved. Add berries.
Let sit until almost jelled, pour over the cheese layer. Chill until set.
Combine pumpkin, salt, spices and brown sugar. Add eggs and milk.
Pour into a sprayed 9x13-inch pan. Sprinkle cake mix over the top.
Pour melted margarine over cake mix. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with nuts if desired and continue to bake for another 20 minutes.
Cool. Serve with whipped topping.
Mix together crumb topping until crumbly. Press half of the mixture in a 9-inch square pan. Cover with rhubarb.
In a small saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, water and vanilla. Cook, stirring until thick and clear. Pour over rhubarb. Top with remaining crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour. Serve plain or with Cool Whip.
Melt margarine; mix with flour and pecans. Press into the pizza pan.
Bake at 250° for 35-40 minutes. Cool.
Beat cream cheese with powdered sugar. Fold in whipped topping. Spread over the crust, forming a raised outer edge.
Bring sugar, cornstarch and 2 (cups) water to a boil in a saucepan. Cool slightly. Stir in gelatin and strawberries. Spread over the cream cheese layer.
Chill until set. Add additional whipped topping for garnish.

name.S: In memory of Bernice and Chris Schumacher by George and Rosaline Schumacher

details.S: Generously grease the bottom only of a 9x13-inch pan. Sprinkle marshmallows evenly over the bottom of the pan. Thoroughly combine completely thawed strawberries and syrup with dry Jello. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Beat for 3 minutes; pour batter evenly over marshmallows in the prepared pan. Spoon strawberry mixture evenly over batter.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes, until golden brown and toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

full_string.S: 1 (10 oz package) frozen chopped spinach - thawed, well drained

details.S: In a skillet, brown sausage and onion; drain. Transfer to a large bowl.

Stir in spinach, cream cheese and egg. Add 1 (cup) mozzarella, cheddar, cottage cheese, Parmesan, salt, pepper and cinnamon if desired; mix well. Stuff shells and arrange in a greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish.
Combine sauce ingredients; mix well. Spoon over shells.
Cover and bake at 350° for 40 minutes. Uncover; sprinkle with remaining mozzarella. Return to oven for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Yield: 8-10 servings.

name.S: small curd cream style cottage cheese

full_string.S: 2 cups small curd cream style cottage cheese
8 oz sharp processed American cheese - shredded

details.S: Cook macaroni according to directions on box; drain well.
Combine cottage cheese, sour cream, egg, salt and pepper. Add shredded cheese, mixing well. Stir in cooked macaroni.
Turn into a 9x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika; bake in a 350° oven for 45 minutes. Makes 6-8 servings.

description.S: Great for Bridal Showers.

full_string.S: 4 oz reduced fat cheddar cheese - shredded
½ cup sweet red pepper - chopped
¼ cup reduced fat plain yogurt
2 tubes refrigerated reduced fat crescent rolls

details.S: Preheat oven to 350°.
In a large bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients. Stir in mayonnaise and yogurt.
Unroll both tubes of crescent rolls onto an ungreased baking sheet; press together, forming a 15x12-inch rectangle. Seal seams and perforations.

Spoon filling lengthwise down the center third of dough. On each long side, cut dough 3 inches toward the center at 1 ½ -inch intervals, forming strips. Bring 1 strip from each side over filling; pinch ends to seal. Repeat. Pinch ends of loaf to seal.
Brush with egg white; sprinkle with almonds. Bake for 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and filling is heated through.

notes.S: browned, drained or 4 chicken breasts (cut into chunks)

full_string.S: 1 ½ lb hamburger - browned, drained or 4 chicken breasts (cut into chunks)

details.S: Mix salsa with drained and browned hamburger; simmer for 10 minutes, set aside. Spray a 9x12-inch cake pan with nonstick coating.

Fill shells with meat mix, place seam side down in pan and repeat with rest. Spread on soup mix, black olives, cheese and paprika in that order. Bake for 30 minutes at 350° . Cool slightly before serving.

full_string.S: 1 package dried beef - shredded into pieces

details.S: Layer the chicken breasts with the bacon wrapped around each piece. Mix all other ingredients and pour over the bacon wrapped chicken. Bake at 400° for 45 minutes. Cook rice separately.

full_string.S: 1 lb uncooked chicken breasts - cut into strips
2 (10 oz cans) green chile enchilada sauce

details.S: Heat oven to 400'. Lightly grease a glass baking dish. In a 10-inch nonstick skillet, cook chicken over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally until no longer pink in center.
Add cream cheese and chilies; reduce heat to medium. Cook and stir until blended and cream cheese is melted.
Spoon chicken filling onto tortillas; roll up and place seam side down in baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce over the top; sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake 15-20 minutes. Makes 12 enchiladas.
Cook vegetables according to package directions; drain. Arrange crosswise in a 12x7½ x2-inch baking pan.

For sauce, in a saucepan melt butter; stir in flour, nutmeg ⅛ (tsp) pepper. Add cream and broth all at once. Cook and stir until bubbly; continue cooking 1-2 minutes more. Add Swiss cheese; stir until melted.
Pour half of the sauce over broccoli. Top with chicken. Pour remaining sauce over all. Sprinkle Parmesan atop. Bake in a 350° oven for 20 minutes or until heated through. Serves 6.

description.S: Nice change from traditional lasagna.

full_string.S: 1 (10 ¾ oz can) cream of mushroom soup

details.S: Prepare lasagna noodles according to package directions.  In a medium saucepan, sauté onion and green pepper in butter until tender. Stir in soup, milk, mushrooms and basil.
In a 9x13-inch baking dish, place half of each of the following: noodles, cottage cheese, American cheese, chicken, sauce and Parmesan cheese; repeat layers.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45 minutes.

full_string.S: ½ cup Stouffers Turkey Stuffing mix

details.S: Preheat the oven to 350°.

Crush stuffing mix and then mix with cheese, parsley, curry and Italian seasoning. In a dish, melt butter in the microwave. Dip chicken in butter and then dip chicken in stuffing mixture on both sides and place in the dish.

Bake for 20 minutes, turn and bake for 20 more minutes. I usually throw the leftover mix on top after I flip. Make sure to remember and make the spaghetti sauce and noodles on the stove top in the last 20 minutes of the chicken baking.

description.S: Quick winter meal.

full_string.S: 1 (15 oz package) Pillsbury refrigerated pie crusts
2 ½-3 (cups) chicken or turkey - cooked, shredded

details.S: Heat oven to 425°. Prepare pie crusts as directed on the package for 2-crust pie using a 9-inch pie pan.
Melt margarine in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion; cook for 2 minutes or until tender. Add flour, salt and pepper; stir until well blended.
Gradually stir in broth and milk, cooking and stirring until bubbly and thickened. Add chicken and mixed vegetables; mix well. Remove from heat.

Spoon chicken mixture into crust-lined pan. Top with second crust; seal edges and flute. Cut slits in several places in top crust. Bake at 425° for 30-40 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

full_string.S: ½ can cream of chicken soup
1 (2.5 oz can) French fried onion rings - may use cheddar onion rings

details.S: Cook chicken breast and cut into 1-inch pieces. Mix ingredients from chicken soup through pepper and add cut up chicken.
Pour ingredients into a casserole dish and top with cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes and then sprinkle onions all over the top and bake 15 minutes longer. Serves 6-8.

full_string.S: 1 approx. 3 lb broiler-fryer chicken - cut up
½ cup butter or margarine - melted, divided

details.S: In a bowl or bag, combine flour, salt and cayenne pepper; add chicken pieces and dredge or shake to coat.
Pour 4 (tbsp) butter into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan, turning pieces once to coat. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 minutes.

Combine brown sugar, honey, lemon juice, soy sauce, curry powder and remaining butter; pour over chicken. Bake 45 minutes more or until the chicken is tender, basting several times with pan drippings. Yield: 4-6 servings.

full_string.S: 1 (12 oz) jar apricot preserves or jam
1 cup green and/or red pepper rings

details.S: Place breast into roaster or can be prepared in a crock pot. Combine jam, dressing and soup mix. Pour over chicken.
Bake, covered, for 1 hour at 350°. (Longer in crock pot.) Take out the oven and add peppers and pineapple. Cashews are optional. Continue to bake another ½ hour. Serve with rice and salad.
Cook the linguini. Sauté onion, pepper and celery in oleo. Combine the rest of the ingredients and stir until mixed well.
Put in a 9x13-inch greased pan and top with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes.

name.S: jar Famous Dave's Original BBQ sauce

full_string.S: 1 jar Famous Dave's Original BBQ sauce

details.S: Brown ribs on both sides in a skillet. Season ribs with pepper. Pour BBQ sauce over ribs. Cover. Bake in a preheated 320° oven for 1½ hours.

full_string.S: 1 turkey breast with bone - approx. 2.75 lb

details.S: Remove skin from turkey breast. Combine remaining ingredients until well blended. Spray roasting pan with cooking spray. Place the turkey breast bone-side down and cover the top with half the sauce.
Bake for 10 minutes at 450°.
Reduce the temperature to 350° and bake for 40 minutes.

Remove foil and spread with remaining glaze. Insert the meat thermometer in the thickest part of the breast and bake, uncovered, until the turkey reaches 165° to 170° (about 40-50 minutes more). Baste with glaze often. Let stand for about 5 minutes before slicing.
Combine ham loaf mix, hamburger, graham cracker crumbs, eggs and milk. Mix and shape into balls.
Mix together vinegar, soup, brown sugar and dry mustard. Pour over the balls. Bake at 325° for 1½ -2 hours. Watch carefully, will burn easily towards the end.

full_string.S: 1 ham steak - fully cooked, 1-1½ Ibs., 1-inch thick

details.S: In a small saucepan, bring brown sugar, horseradish and lemon juice to a boil. Brush over both sides of ham. Grill over medium-hot heat, turning once, until heated through and well glazed, about 20-25 minutes. Yields: 4 servings.

full_string.S: 6 medium potatoes - peeled, thinly sliced, about 2 (lb)

details.S: Place ½ the ham into a 2-quart casserole. Cover with half the potatoes and half the onion.

Sift half the flour over; season with salt and pepper. Repeat layers ending with flour on top. Pour milk over all. Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 1-1¼ hours or until potatoes are nearly tender. Uncover. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake for an additional 15 minutes or until done.

full_string.S: 8 oz American cheese - cubed or grated

details.S: Stir sour cream, soup, American cheese and ham into the potatoes. Put into a 9x13-inch pan. Spread evenly. Bake at 350° for 45-50 minutes, depending on how deep the potatoes are in the pan.
Combine corn flakes and melted butter and sprinkle over potatoes. Sprinkle mozzarella on top and bake for 10-15 minutes longer.

full_string.S: 1 (1 lb package) pasta - penne, bow ties, etc.
½ cup Monterey Jack cheese - cubed or Parmesan
1 tbsp fresh basil - or 1 tsp dried basil

details.S: Cook pasta. In a pan, sauté‚ onion and garlic salt until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Drain pasta and add sauce. Toss and serve. Serves 7.

name.S: Pork Chops With Rice Stefanie Brunkhorst

full_string.S: 6 pork chops or pork steaks - amount as desired
1 can chicken rice soup - more if desired

details.S: Spread both sides of meat with a light layer of mustard. Dredge in flour. Brown in a skillet with a little oil. Place meat in a roasting pan. Spoon rice soup over meat; then add ½ can water to the skillet to get all browning from the pan.
Pour over chops. Cover with foil. Bake until tender. Serve with more rice. Use juice on meat as gravy.
Combine flour, salt and pepper in a plastic bag. Pound meat with the flour mixture. Brown meat with shortening on both sides.
Place in a roasting pan with chopped onions, tomatoes and juice. Cook 1 ½ hours at 350°. You can thicken juice for gravy. Serves 8.

full_string.S: 4-5 lb beef - rump, chuck, or brisket
1 cup BBQ sauce - I use Cookies Brand

details.S: Mix together onion salt, salt, garlic salt, celery salt and Worcestershire sauce. Rub onto both sides of meat. Bake in a pan at 225° for 8 hours.
Pour off part of the liquid and cool. Slice meat thinly or shred. Put back in the pan.
Combine sugar, salad dressing, and BBQ sauce. Combine sauce with liquid and pour over meat. Return to the oven and heat through at 300°-325°. Best if made the day before serving.
Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, salt, pepper, onion and celery and shape into oval patties, about 1-inch thick.
Using a small amount of butter, brown on both sides in a skillet.
After browning, place in an oven dish with a lid. Combine soup and water; pour over and around meat. Cook slowly at 300° for 25 minutes in a preheated oven.

notes.S: I have used thin sirloin also

full_string.S: 3 lb round steak or chuck - I have used thin sirloin also
1 ½ stalks celery - sliced or diced

details.S: Using a meat hammer, pound flour into both sides until absorbed. Sauté meat, brown on both sides. Sprinkle meat with salt and pepper.
Spread onion, celery and green pepper over steak. Add chili sauce mixed with water.
Cover and bake in a 300° oven for 2-2½ hours or at 325 for 1½ hours. Drippings can be thickened for gravy. Serves 6.
Brown meat. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer about 3 hours or until meat is tender.
Remove bay leaf. Serves 6. I make this a day early and serve over noodles or potatoes. Great for a quick warm up dinner if you are having guests.

name.S: Patricia Maas, In Memory of My Mom, Mae Brunkhorst

details.S: Brown hamburger and diced onion. Cook until done.
Add home canned tomatoes. Heat. Add cooked macaroni. Season to taste. We kids enjoyed this recipe. it contains no beans, but we called it Chili Con Came.

name.S: Patricia Maas, In Memory of My Mom, Mae Brunkhorst

details.S: Mix the first 5 ingredients together. Put in loaf pan.
Add cream of mushroom soup on top. Bake 45 minutes at 350°.
Add Chinese noodles; bake 20 minutes longer.
Brown ground beef, season and mix with onion; simmer until onion is done.
Cook noodles in salted water until barely soft. Mix all ingredients together in a baking dish. You may wish to spread a little soup on the top and sprinkle with some crushed corn flakes.
Bake until heated through in a moderate oven.
Preheat oven to 375°. Brown meat and drain.
Stir vegetables and gravy into meat. Spoon into a 9-inch square baking dish.
Mix potatoes, cream cheese, ½ cup of the shredded cheese and garlic until well blended. Put potato mixture on top of meat.
Sprinkle the remaining ½ (cup) shredded cheese on top. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.

full_string.S: 2 lb round steak - chicken or pork
½ cup beef or chicken broth

details.S: Cut meat cross grain in paper thin slices. Combine the soy sauce, broth, sugar, pepper and Accent.
Brown the meat and pour soy sauce mixture with rest of ingredients over the meat.
Serve on rice or vermicelli noodles (very thin noodles).

full_string.S: ½ cup black olives - pitted, minced

details.S: Mix all the ingredients in a food processor. Spread about 3-4 (tbsp) of the mixture on top of one tortilla.
Roll up like a jelly roll; wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate or freeze. Repeat with remaining mixture.
When you're ready to serve, slice the rolls into ¼-inch slices.

Bake the spirals on a lightly greased baking pan at 400° for 12-15 minutes. This makes a huge batch...so you can just bake what you need and leave the remaining rolled up tortillas frozen until the next hungry bunch comes over.

notes.S: whole or jellied, I prefer whole cranberry sauce

full_string.S: 1 can cranberries - whole or jellied, I prefer whole cranberry sauce

details.S: Preheat oven to 350°. Mix meatball ingredients together and shape into balls, placing into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Combine all sauce ingredients and simmer for 15 minutes.  Pour over uncooked meatballs.
Cook, covered in the oven for 45 minutes. Then, cook uncovered for 15 more minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

notes.S: drained, saving liquid, blend the soup if kids don't like the looks of rice in meatballs

full_string.S: 1 can chicken rice soup - drained, saving liquid, blend the soup if kids don't like the looks of rice in meatballs

name.S: cream of mushroom soup or cream of chicken soup

full_string.S: 1 can cream of mushroom soup or cream of chicken soup
¾ cup bread or cracker crumbs

details.S: Reserve the soup juice for gravy. Mix all ingredients, except cream of mushroom or cream of chicken soup.
Shape into balls. Brown. Place browned meatballs into a roaster and add pan drippings and soup juice.
Mix 1 can cream soup with ½ can water. Pour over meatballs.
Bake in a 350° oven for 45 minutes, covered, and 15 minutes, uncovered. Great served with mashed potatoes or noodles.
Combine all meatloaf ingredients thoroughly. Pack firmly into an ungreased 8½ x 4½ x 2½-inch loaf pan.
Bake 1 hour 15 minutes at 350°. Let stand 5 minutes before slicing.
If desired, mix topping ingredients and spread across meatloaf.

full_string.S: ¾ cup milk - can use evaporated

details.S: Combine meatloaf ingredients. Place into a loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or more.
Combine topping ingredients. Spread topping on top of meatloaf halfway through baking.

full_string.S: Favorite meatloaf recipe - prepared, set aside

details.S: Place meatloaf mixture over top of potatoes. Frost meatloaf with ketchup, mustard and brown sugar if desired.
Bake in a 350° oven until done. Recipe may be doubled and placed into a 9x13-inch pan but needs to be baked longer.
Combine all ingredients, except fettuccine. Simmer over low heat until smooth, stirring constantly.
Pour over fettuccine, toss lightly. May thin with a little milk if fettuccine seems too thick. May add sliced cooked chicken breast or cooked shrimp if desired.
Cook meat until it is brown. Stir in the undrained tomatoes and tomato paste. Stir in basil. Cover; simmer 15 minutes, stirring often.
Meanwhile, cook noodles following directions on box. Drain and rinse noodles.
Beat eggs; add cottage cheese, cheddar cheese and parsley flakes and ½ (tsp) pepper.
Layer half of the noodles in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish; spread with half of the cottage cheese filling. Add half of the mozzarella cheese and half the meat sauce.
Repeat layers. Bake at 375' for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes.

description.S: Optional: Can substitute 2 (tsp) Italian seasoning for basil and oregano.

details.S: Brown meat and add the next 10 ingredients (Pizza Quick sauce through pepper). Combine cottage, mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese.

In a 9x13-inch pan, layer ½ meat sauce, raw noodles, cheese mixture, raw noodles, ½ meat sauce and cheese mixture. Cover with foil and bake in a preheated oven, 350° degrees, for 60 minutes. Remove foil and continue to bake 15 minutes more. Let rest 10-15 minutes before serving.
Prepare shells according to package directions. Combine cheeses, pepper, eggs and parsley. Stuff shells using plastic bag with corner cut off.
Brown ground beef; add spaghetti sauce. Add oregano and basil to meat mixture. Pour over shells.
Bake at 350° degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with more cheese when almost done. Serves 6.

description.S: This recipe was always prepared for the day after Thanksgiving when the women went shopping to Cedar Rapids and the men toiled on the farm.

details.S: Place meat into a small roaster. Add vegetables. Blend spices and sprinkle on top. Add tomatoes. Cover. Bake for 4 hours at 250°.

full_string.S: ½ lb fresh or frozen green beans

details.S: Put meat into a casserole dish; sprinkle with Accent (MSG seasoning) and garlic salt. Slice onion and separate into rings; lay on top of meat.
Cut celery, carrots, potatoes and beans in chunks; add to meat. Mix salt, sugar and tapioca; sprinkle over all. Add juice. Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 3 hours.
Put seasoned beef in a casserole dish. Mix tapioca, sugar and salt together; sprinkle over meat. Add vegetables and cover with tomato juice. Cover with lid. Bake at 350° for 3½-4 hours.
Mix browned hamburger and pizza sauce; spread in a 9x13-inch pan. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top.

Combine Bisquick, milk and eggs; beat with a fork (will be very runny). Pour over top of mozzarella cheese and put shredded cheddar cheese on top. Use as much or as little as you desire. Bake for 15 minutes at 425 degrees.

description.S: Optional toppings may be added: onions, olives, mushrooms, green peppers and ham.

details.S: In a skillet, brown ground beef; season as desired and drain. Stir in spaghetti sauce.
Quarter the biscuits; place into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, top with beef mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 20-25 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheeses; bake an additional 5-10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5-10 minutes before serving.

description.S: You can substitute any pizza ingredients such as sausage for ground beef.

details.S: Brown ground beef, onion and green pepper. Add sauce and simmer. Cook noodles as directed on bag.

Layer in crock pot the meat mixture, noodles, cheese, mushrooms and pepperoni until full. Cook on low until cheese melts; about 3-4 hours. Alternatively, layer in a 9x13-inch pan and bake at 350° degrees for about 30 minutes.

description.S: Optional: May squeeze lemon juice over the top for more flavor.Note: Make sure tomatoes and lobster meat are well drained before putting onto pizza otherwise crust will be soggy.Can be used as an appetizer or for a main dish.

name.S: oz lobster or shrimp (cut into ½ to ¾-inch chunks)

full_string.S: 2 oz lobster or shrimp (cut into ½ to ¾-inch chunks)

details.S: Brush the top side of tortilla with garlic butter. Sprinkle 2 (tbsp) Parmesan cheese over the garlic butter. Add drained, diced tomatoes; sprinkle evenly over Parmesan cheese. Add basil.

Sprinkle seafood over top. Sprinkle the Italian cheese blend evenly over the top of tomatoes. Refrigerate until ready to bake. Brush the pizza pan lightly with vegetable oil. Bake at 450 for 4-5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Slice into 8 slices.

full_string.S: 1 tsp Italian seasoning Salt and pepper

details.S: Cook noodles; drain and set aside. Sauté shrimp, scallops and onion. Add all seasonings.
In a 9x13-inch pan, alternate ingredients starting with noodles. Top with remaining sauce and cheese. Bake at 325 for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes and then cut and serve. Serves 8.

description.S: The girls always called these Humpty Durnpties!!! These were Jennifer Brunkhorst's favorites.

details.S: Mix together all ingredients. Make into patties. Fry in part shortening and margarine until golden brown.

Mix bread crumbs, cracker crumbs and melted butter together. Put a thin layer in a shallow baking dish, cover with half the oysters and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add 2 (tbsp) oyster liquid and 1 (tbsp) milk or cream. Repeat; cover the top with the rest of the crumbs. Bake for 20 minutes at 450 degrees.

Leave the skin on while you cook. You can eat it after it is cooked or just take the meat off with a fork. The skin has good flavor. Put lemon slices under the fish. Sprinkle or rub some fish seasoning on the top and save some lemons to squeeze over it when it is done.

Cook it on tin foil (heavy duty), skin side down, on the grill, with the sides folded up. You can tell when salmon is done by testing it with a fork. It should be somewhat flaky and juicy and the color should be light pink. Try not to over cook. 8-10 minutes on a hot grill, should do it, for ½ to ¾-inch pieces.

name.S: jars Ragu roasted garlic Parmesan sauce or Alfredo sauce

full_string.S: 2 (1 lb) jars Ragu roasted garlic Parmesan sauce or Alfredo sauce

name.S: linguine noodles (cooked using instructions on box)

full_string.S: 1 lb linguine noodles (cooked using instructions on box)

details.S: Melt butter in skillet. Add garlic and slowly sauté scallops, until cooked. Remove from pan and set aside.
Cook cod or tilapia. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat shrimp and crab meat. Steam broccoli for 5 minutes. Heat sauce; add seafood and broccoli. Serve over precooked linguine or mix together.

full_string.S: ½ tsp hot red pepper flakes
1 bunch green onions (chopped - including 1 inch of green)

details.S: In a medium bowl, mix shrimp with ⅓ (cup) of the Italian dressing. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.

In a small bowl, mix together peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, ginger, red pepper flakes and remaining Italian dressing. Set aside. After the shrimp has marinated for 1 hour, cook pasta. Rinse with hot water and keep warm.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, heat vegetable oil and sesame oil. Add carrot and cook for 1 minute. Drain marinade from shrimp. Add shrimp and green onions to the saucepan and cook, stirring constantly, about 3 minutes or until shrimp are opaque.
In a large serving bowl, toss hot pasta with reserved peanut butter sauce and shrimp mixture. Toss well.

description.S: “Shortly after marrying my husband, Philip, Chris Goetschel was visiting. Chris and I had an awesome time as I taught him how to make apple pie. Way to go Chris!” --Aunt Ann Brunkhorst

details.S: -INCH PIE:
-INCH PIE:

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Prepare pastry. Stir together sugar, flour, nutmeg, cinnamon and salt; mix with apples. Turn into a pastry-lined pie pan; dot with butter. Cover with top crust; cutting slits into top. Seal edges. Brush top with milk. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce oven to 350° and continue to bake for 45 minutes. I like using a "mushy" type apple like Macintosh.
Mix pudding and milk with an electric mixer, then add 8 oz Cool Whip and finish mixing. Add sliced bananas to the mixture and put in the pie shell.
Top with remaining Cool Whip and sprinkle nuts or sliced almonds on top to garnish.
Chill 1 hour before serving.

In a  heavy saucepan, dissolve cornstarch in water,  stir in sweetened condensed milk and egg yolk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat; add margarine and vanilla. Cool slightly.
Slice 2 bananas; dip in lemon juice and drain. Stir bananas into pudding mixture and pour into the crust. Cover.
Chill 4 hours or until set. Spread top with whipped cream. Garnish top if desired. Refrigerate.
Combine and pour into pie shell. Top with crust. Cut slits into top. Brush top with milk.
Bake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350° degrees for 40-45 minutes.

description.S: CHERRY PIE - THANKSGIVING RECIPEPatricia MaasMy sister, Mary Jo McFadden, always told me to use Wilderness Pie Filling so I use that pie filling for my Cherry Pies!Note: This recipe is used every Thanksgiving.

name.S: Double crust for 9-inch pie (homemade or purchased)

full_string.S: Double crust for 9-inch pie (homemade or purchased)

name.S: Wilderness Original Country Cherry Pie Filling or Topping

full_string.S: 2 (21 oz cans) Wilderness Original Country Cherry Pie Filling or Topping

details.S: In a saucepan, combine chocolate chips, egg and water and heat until melted. Reserve ½ of mixture. Coat pie crust with ½ of the chocolate and set aside.
With mixer, combine 8 oz Cool Whip with remaining chocolate until blended.
Layer Cool Whip, chocolate mixture and remaining Cool Whip into crust. Drizzle chocolate syrup on top for a garnish. Cool 1 hour before serving.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Line a 9-inch pie pan with pie crust. Pour cherry pie filling evenly into pie crust. Place vented or lattice crust over filling or create decorative top crust using cookie cutters to make shapes. Lay directly on fruit filling. Crimp edges to seal.
Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake for an additional 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Serves 6-8.

description.S: Philip's favorite pie.

full_string.S: 1 (4 oz package) Baker's German sweet chocolate

details.S: Heat chocolate and 2 (tbsp) of the milk over low heat, stirring until chocolate is melted.
Beat sugar into cream cheese; add remaining milk and chocolate mixture and beat until smooth. Fold in Cool Whip, blending until smooth.
Spoon into crust. Freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
Beat eggs until light and add salt. Add sugar and milk. Pour into unbaked crust, sprinkle cinnamon over the top.
Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes and then reduce to 350° degrees for approximately 35-45 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350° . Beat all ingredients together, pour into a greased 10-inch pie plate. Bake for 45 minutes. Do not over cook. Refrigerate and the center will settle. This recipe makes its own crust!

In a frying pan, toast ¼ (cup) coconut and set aside. In a mixing bowl, combine pudding and milk. Then add half of Cool Whip and mix well. Stir in the remaining coconut by hand and pour into the prepared 10-inch pie crust. Top with remaining Cool Whip and garnish with the toasted coconut. Chill 1 hour before serving.

name.S: pastry shell (baked) or graham cracker crumb crust

full_string.S: 1 (8 or 9-inch) pastry shell (baked) or graham cracker crumb crust
1 (14 oz can) Eagle Brand sweetened milk

details.S: Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a medium bowl, beat egg yolks. Stir in sweetened condensed milk, ReaLemon and food coloring, if desired. Pour into prepared pastry shell.
Bake for 30 minutes. Cool. Chill. Spread with whipped topping after cooled. Garnish as desired. (Can also use a meringue topping if desired).

full_string.S: 1 cup instant lemon or vanilla pudding

details.S: Mix cream cheese, lemon juice, milk, pudding and lemon rind until smooth. Then add 10 oz of the Cool whip and beat for 1 minute. Pour into the pie shell. Top with Cool Whip and garnish with lemon slices or grated lemon rind. Chill.

Combine in a medium bowl, the peanut butter, cream cheese and sugar. Gently fold in 3 (cups) of Cool Whip. Spoon mixture into pie crust. Smooth to even layer. Place hot fudge in microwave; spread over pie. Refrigerate. Put the rest of the whipped cream on before serving.

description.S: This is Michael's favorite pie - It should serve 8, but we usually only get about 4 servings :)

details.S: For filling, in a medium bowl, combine eggs, corn syrup, sugar, butter, vanilla and salt. Mix chocolate chips, coconut and walnuts together; put in pie crust. Pour egg mixture over all, spreading evenly.

Place foil around the edge of the crust. Bake at 350° degrees for 30 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 20-25 minutes more or until filling appears set when you shake pie. Cool, cover and store in the refrigerator.
Combine and pour into a pie shell. Top with crust. Cut slits into top. Brush top with milk. Bake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350° degrees for 40-45 minutes.

description.S: Blend until smooth milk and pudding mixes. Fold in peanut butter. Put in a graham cracker crust and top with Cool Whip.
Served many years for Thanksgiving!Thanks, Aunt Patricia

details.S: Beat eggs; add sugar and syrup and then salt and butter. Put pecans in the bottom of an unbaked pie crust and add filling. Bake at 350° degrees for 50-60 minutes.

name.S: Libby's Famous Pumpkin Pie - Thanksgiving Recipe

description.S: This is the recipe used every Thanksgiving by me.

details.S: Mix sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves in a small bowl. Beat eggs in a large  bowl.  Stir in  pumpkin  and  sugar-spice  mixture.  Gradually stir in evaporated milk. Pour into the shell.
Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350° degrees and bake for 40-50 minutes or until knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 2 hours. Serve or refrigerate.
¾ tsp. pumpkin spice may be substituted for the cinnamon, ginger and cloves.

name.S: granulated white sugar (or can use half white sugar and half brown sugar

full_string.S: ¾ cup granulated white sugar (or can use half white sugar and half brown sugar - packed)

details.S: Combine filling ingredients in the order given. Pour into pie crust. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes then for 45 minutes at 350° degrees. May need to bake a little longer until the center is set and the knife inserted comes out clean.

name.S: George and Rosaline Schumacher, In Memory of Chris and Bernice Schumacher

details.S: Combine ingredients; mix until crumbly mixture, saving ½ (cup) for topping. Pat remaining ingredients into a 9-inch pie pan to form crust.
Pour into the crust. Sprinkle remaining crumbs on top. Bake at 350° degrees for around 35 minutes.
Beat egg and add sugar, cornstarch, nutmeg and cream. Stir in rhubarb and bake in a double crust at 350° degrees for 45 minutes or until done.

description.S: Per serving:         368 calories,         17 g fat, 4 g protein, 58 g carbohydrates,         2 g fiber, 272 mg sodium.

full_string.S: 1 tbsp chilled butter (cut into small pieces)
¼ cup chilled butter (cut into small pieces)

details.S: Preheat oven to 350° . To prepare the pastry, mix flour with salt and sugar. Pour in vegetable oil and milk. Mix well with a fork. Transfer to a deep-dish pie pan and press with fingers to spread over the bottom and up the sides of the pan.
To prepare the filling, combine rhubarb with sugar and flour. Spoon into pie crust. Dot  with butter.

To prepare the topping, mix butter, sugar and flour (with a pastry blender or your hands) until crumbly. Sprinkle over rhubarb mixture. Bake for 1 hour or until filling is bubbling and topping is browned. Serves 10.

Cook rhubarb and sugar without water until rhubarb is tender. Add gelatin. Stir and cool. Whip evaporated milk which has been thoroughly chilled. Add lemon juice. description.S: This amount of cabbage will pack into a 2-qt. jar, which will help you figure out how many jars of kraut you wish to make. This recipe was used by Della Brunkhorst Wintakger and her mother Anna Brunkhorst.

details.S: Mix the shredded cabbage very carefully with the salt. Pack into sterilized 2-qt. jars. Press down the cabbage until the juice runs out and covers it. If the juice does not cover, add a weak brine made by adding 1 (tbsp) of salt to 2 (cups) of water. Hold the cabbage down under the brine by slipping 2 strips of wood, crosswise in the jar below the neck. Wipe off the top of the jar with a clean damp cloth. Place a rubber ring on top. Screw down top until it catches and no more.

Set jars on an enamel tray to catch the juice that will leak out during fermentation. Let stand until fermentation ceases, which will be about 10 days. The bubbling will stop when the fermentation is over. If, at this time, the juice does not cover the cabbage, add more brine to the jar.
This will keep for several weeks if transferred to a cold place. If you wish to keep it longer, the jars will have to be processed for 30 minutes in a boiling water bath.
For best results you should use pure granulated salt, which is called bag salt or dairy salt. Do not use table or rock salt.
If you haven't an enamel tray be sure and use old pans or trays so that it won't matter if they become rusty.
For good results, use a thermometer to test the surrounding temperature and don't guess at it. Temperatures are carefully held where kraut is made on a large scale for canning.
And don't guess at the amount of salt, or "think" you have 4 (lb) of shredded cabbage; actually weigh it.

There is a quick and simple way to peel kiwi fruit with a teaspoon. This method works best with fruit that is ripe but not too soft. First cut off both ends of a kiwi. Then slip a teaspoon just under the skin, matching the spoon's curve to the curve of the fruit. Now slide the spoon around the kiwi to separate the fruit from the skin, being careful not to dig into the flesh. Once the spoon has been completely run around the fruit, it will easily slip out of the skin in one smooth piece!
